GET /api.description: serves up a json representation of all the available endpoints of the api

GET /api/categories.description: serves an array of all categories

categories.description: Players attempt to uncover each other's hidden role

GET /api/reviews.description: serves an array of all reviews without review body and with comment count for each review, by default sorted by created by date

queries.category: which selects the reviews by the category value specified in the query. If the query is omitted the endpoint should respond with all reviews.
queries.sort_by: which sorts the articles by any valid column (defaults to date)
queries.order: asc or desc for ascending or descending (defaults to descending)

GET /api/reviews/:review_id.description: serves a review object by review_id

exampleResponse.title: Build you own tour de Yorkshire
exampleResponse.review_body: Cold rain pours on the faces of your team of cyclists, you pulled to the front of the pack early and now your taking on exhaustion cards like there is not tomorrow, you think there are about 2 hands left until you cross the finish line, will you draw enough from your deck to cross before the other team shoot passed? Flamee Rouge is a Racing deck management game where you carefully manage your deck in order to cross the line before your opponents, cyclist can fall slyly behind front runners in their slipstreams to save precious energy for the prefect moment to burst into the lead

PATCH /api/reviews/:review_id.description: updates votes of a review by review_id, takes an object with inc_votes key and int value (above or below 0) and increments or decrements that reviews votes by the passed value

exampleResponse.title: Culture a Love of Agriculture With Agricola
exampleResponse.review_body: You could sum up Agricola with the simple phrase 'Farmyard Fun' but the mechanics and game play add so much more than that. You'll find yourself torn between breeding pigs, or sowing crops. Its joyeous and rewarding and it makes you think of time spent outside, which is much harder to do these days!

GET /api/reviews/:review_id/comments.description: serves a comments array with by review_id, sorted by created by date

POST /api/reviews/:review_id/comments.description: adds a comment by review_id, takes a username and body, and returns added comment

DELETE /api/comments/:comment_id.description: removes a comment by comments_id, returns nothing
